Jotunn seated himself in front of the projector. He did not wish to
let the=
 others discuss, merely to let them know. He signaled for the
recording to =
begin.

Jotunn: My fellow Lords, I am sure that by now you are beginning to=

realize what is going on. My forces have paralyzed most Governmental
army =
outposts and, by now, have attacked the Parliament Building in
Relay. That =
attack has been thwarted, thanks to one of you's valiant
efforts. However, =
I must let you know: this is not the last of the
Iron Skulls' actions.

Jot=
unn: You might wonder at my motives. Perhaps you are starting to
categorize=
 me with Starscream or one of the Megatrons... Let me make
one thing clear:=
 I am not them. My objectives never were and never
will be anything else th=
an stones on the path to the destruction of
the Minions and their Master. B=
y seizing the power from the
Government, I ensure two things: a focused vis=
ion as to the fight
before us and a certainty that things will get done. Th=
e Government
was only a way for us to avert our eyes from the hard, cold tr=
uth: we
are losing a war that will ultimately extinguish our sparks should =
we
go on like this.

Jotunn: I do not care if you hate me or want to destro=
y me. With what
I am doing, you might have the leisure to do so for a long =
time now=AD.

He cut the communication and ordered the message sent to the =
other
Lords...

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <warriorazure@...> wro=
te:
>
> Jotunn entered the underground base with a fierce determination tha=
t
> unsettled even the local Garison Commander. He had been prepared to
> w=
elcome his Lord, but he had not been prepared for the Lord's actual
> rejec=
tion of the welcome party. Jotunn was here on business. That was
> as simpl=
e as it could get.
> 
> He got up on an elevator and descended further in t=
he hidden fortress.
> He had not planned to actually take the Parliament wi=
th Wave 1. That,
> even with the best estimates, would have been wishful th=
inking, and he
> had not survived for so long as he had on wishful thinking=
. Wave 2,
> however, would show his supremacy undeniably.
> 
> The elevator=
 stopped in front of the largest door ever seen. It was
> conceived to with=
stand the worst Minions could pack. This was a place
> of the utmost securi=
ty and the greatest importance. He waited for the
> security lock to scan h=
is energy signature and the door to open with a
> very low rumble and a con=
stant shuddering. He stepped in...
> 
> ...only to find the Airtankers goin=
g at each other with a card game.
> 
> - I say, Bombtube, that was quite a =
nice bluff there. Too bad I had
> the better hand.
> 
> - Don' make me laug=
h, Gunrain! I shoulda been mo careful: you can'
> lie! Ther' was somfin you=
 were up to!
> 
> - Stop bickering, you two! You only got lucky for now! Lo=
ck-on, girl!
> Start shuffling better!
> 
> - Blaming me for your loss, Mot=
herload? Yet we all know Skysword's the
> biggest cheater here!
> 
> Jotunn=
 took out a pistol and fired once. The shot rang out in the
> hangar and th=
e bullet finally ended by shooting through the deck of
> cards. The Airtank=
ers immediately pulled out their weapons and aimed
> at the door. Once they=
 realized who was there, they quickly put it all
> away and stood at attent=
ion.
> 
> Jotunn: Well, is this how you get ready? I believe I told the
> C=
ommander to have you ready to set out as soon as I got here. Has that
> not=
 been done?
> 
> Motherload: My Lord, with all due respect, we are posted i=
n that
> weakling's base, but he has no power over us. He fears us and thus=
 has
> no basis on which he can give us orders. We answer to you only.
> 
>=
 Jotunn: And was it not mentioned to you I gave the order? Do not mock
> me=
 Motherload; you're smarter than that. You know only I command you
> and wo=
uld dare issue your orders.
> 
> Skysword: And what would be your orders no=
w, O Lord?
> 
> Jotunn: Stand by for two cycles. Review your weaponry. I ha=
ve to
> communicate with my fellow lords, but should their answer be...
> u=
nsatisfactory, we head out.
> 
> A grin came across Skysword's faceplate.
>=
 
> Skysword: =AD"We", Lord?
> 
> Jotunn: Yes... Me too.
> 
> He left them =
there, had the door closed up, and went back to the
> command center near t=
he frozen surface.
>
